abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Public
            Financial Management and Accountability Project is to
            strengthen public financial management by strengthening the:
            1) mobilization of public resources, 2) management of public
            resources, 3) management of human resources, and 4) external
            audit. The closing date for the project will be extended
            from January 15, 2012 until January 15, 2013. This extension
            is necessary to support key reform activities to achieve the
            projects stated objectives which include support to the
            treasury, core activities in the preparation for the
            Financial Management Information System (FMIS)
            implementation, and Public Financial Management (PFM)
            related capacity development toward improved good governance
            and transparent use of public resources. This will be the
            first extension of the project.
